profileAlternative.name: Vaibhav Sagar
profileAlternative.headline: Software Developer at Obsidian Systems LLC
profileAlternative.summary: I used to write web applications for a living. I still do, but I used to, too. Enthusiastic about writing better software with fewer bugs through functional programming and formal methods.

aboutAlternative.text: I used to write web applications for a living. I still do, but I used to, too. Enthusiastic about writing better software with fewer bugs through functional programming and formal methods.

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Software development and consulting with Haskell and Nix, specialising in the Reflex FRP framework.

positions.title: Software Engineer - DevOps
positions.description: Realising the promise of functional DevOps across six countries and hundreds of servers with Nix.

positions.title: Participant
positions.description: Participated in a full-time, self-directed programming retreat. Focused on becoming better at functional programming and diving deep into my tools by implementing a subset of git in Haskell and using it to make a git internals workshop and a web server that serves git objects as JSON.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Developing and supporting Drupal, CiviCRM, and Wordpress websites.

positions.title: Junior Software Developer
positions.description: Developed a web application for finding affordable housing and the front end of a native iOS application for user generated films.

positions.title: Tutor
positions.description: Ran tutorials using Haskell to teach computer science concepts with an emphasis on functional programming.

positions.title: CSIRO
positions.description: Building on my work as a vacation scholar.

positions.title:
Title
Volunteer Fellow
positions.description: Building on my work as a vacation scholar.

positions.title:
Title
Vacation Scholar
positions.description: Developed a prototype workflow engine for RESTful web services using a continuation passing style built on Semantic Web technologies.

positions.title: Student Ambassador
positions.location: College of Engineering and Computer Science
positions.description: Represented the College for various recruitment events and activities and spoke to prospective students about living in Canberra and studying at the ANU. Ran labs in Processing for high schoolers as an introduction to programming.

positions.title: Senior IT Consultant
positions.description: Kept the College network, printers and residents' computers running smoothly.

positions.title: IT Administrator
positions.description: Led the IT Team for maintenance of systems at College and technical support for residents and assisted with the transition to an external technical support provider.

positions.title: College of Engineering and Computer Science Faculty Representative
Tutor
positions.description: COMP1100 Introduction to Programming and Algorithms.

positions.title: IT Consultant
positions.description: Fixed computer and network issues for residents.

given.text: Vaibhav is a great team member. He is generous in sharing what he knows with others, and always looking to improve his own skills. He is a good communicator, and has the ability to write good code and to explain to non-technical people how a system works.

items: Foundations of Economic and Financial Models
